alert.note: Alert for Oregon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oregon County through 645 PM CDT... At 611 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Thayer, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Oregon County, including the following locations... Myrtle and Couch. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
